message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper presents a method for Maximum A Posteriori (MAP) inference in Statistical Relational Learning, specifically in the context of Markov Logic. This falls under the broad category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The tasks evaluated in the paper, Semantic Role Labelling and Joint Entity Resolution, are both natural language processing tasks, which suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses Integer Linear Programming, which is a common optimization technique in the field of Cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the paper involves solving large and complex Markov Networks, which could be relevant to the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS).
